Activity: Arrive at the office, prepare a cup of coffee, and check emails for urgent requests or updates related to the EHR collection project. Prioritize emails and flag those requiring immediate action.
Review the week's goals and objectives regarding data quality metrics and database schema integration. Plan the day's tasks, focusing on the most critical items.
Begin researching existing data quality metrics used in healthcare, specifically for influenza-related data. Look for industry standards and best practices to adapt to our specific needs.

Draft an initial list of data quality metrics, including accuracy, completeness, consistency, and timeliness, with specific examples related to influenza data (e.g., correct ICD-10 codes, complete vaccination dates).

Schedule a meeting with @da-1, @da-2, @clinlead-1 and @his-1 to discuss the drafted data quality metrics and gather feedback from a clinical and analytical perspective. @PEOPLE: Initial Data Quality Metrics Review
Lunch Break. Head to the cafeteria for lunch. Socialize with colleagues.
Attend the data quality metrics review meeting. Present the drafted metrics and actively participate in the discussion, taking detailed notes on suggested improvements and additions.
Revise the initial data quality metrics based on the feedback received during the meeting. Refine the definitions and ensure they are measurable and achievable.
Prepare a summary document of the revised data quality metrics, ready to share with the Database Administrator and IT Project Manager. @PEOPLE: Data Quality Metrics Summary for DBA and ITPM Review.
Review the upcoming tasks for the week and prepare for the next day. Organize workspace and shut down computer.
